meanings.definition: A person who entertains guests at a resort or similar establishment.
meanings.sent1: The tummlers at the resort organized fun games for the guests.
meanings.sent2: The tummlers at the hotel made sure everyone had a great time during their stay.
meanings.sent3: The tummlers joked with the guests to keep them entertained.
meanings.sent4: The tummlers were like the heart of the resort, pumping energy into every activity.
meanings.sent5: The tummlers' laughter echoed through the halls, bringing joy to all.

meanings.definition: A lively, sociable person who encourages others to participate in activities.
meanings.sent1: As a tummlers, Sarah always got everyone excited to join in the games.
meanings.sent2: The tummlers in the group chat kept suggesting new things for us to do together.
meanings.sent3: The tummlers' enthusiasm was contagious, making everyone eager to join in.
meanings.sent4: She was the tummlers of the party, sparking life into every conversation.
meanings.sent5: His role as the tummlers was to bring people together and create a fun atmosphere.

meanings.definition: A person who creates a lively atmosphere at a social gathering.
meanings.sent1: The tummlers at the wedding had everyone dancing and laughing all night.
meanings.sent2: She was known as the tummlers of the group, always making gatherings more enjoyable.
meanings.sent3: The tummlers' jokes kept the party alive and vibrant.
meanings.sent4: His presence was like that of a tummlers, filling the room with energy.
meanings.sent5: The tummlers' charisma lit up the room, making the event unforgettable.
